t: The Protection of the Most High
The*pn one who lives under the protection of the Most High dwells*ln in the shadow of the Almighty.
I*pn will say concerning the Lord,*s who is my refuge and my fortress, my*ln God in whom I trust:
He*ln himself will rescue you from the bird trap, from*ln the destructive plague.
He*ln will cover you with his feathers; you*ln will take refuge under his wings. His*ln faithfulness will be a protective shield.
You*ln will not fear the terror of the night, the*ln arrow that flies by day,
the*ln plague that stalks in darkness, or*ln the pestilence that ravages at noon.
Though*ln a thousand fall at your side and*ln ten thousand at your right hand, the*ln pestilence will not reach you.
You*ln will only see it with your eyes and*ln witness the punishment of the wicked.
Because*pn you have made the Lord-*s my refuge, the*ln Most Highâ€‰- your dwelling place,
no*ln harm will come to you; no*ln plague will come near your tent.
For*ln he will give his angels orders concerning you, to*ln protect you in all your ways.
They*ln will support you with their hands so*ln that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
You*ln will tread on the lion and the cobra; you*ln will trample the young lion and the serpent.
Because*pn he has his heart set on me, I*ln will deliver him; I*ln will protect him because he knows my name.
When*ln he calls out to me, I will answer him; I*ln will be with him in trouble. I*ln will rescue him and give him honor.
I*ln will satisfy him with a long life and*ln show him my salvation.
